intro: Pothomorphe baileyorum var. paucispica, commonly known as the slender pothomorphe, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
